messages.subject: Re: koumitsushi question again for Shinsei
messages.msgSnippet: Hi,I had read an article about Masamune before in some Japanese history magazine,Rekishi Dokuhon or so.But I forget where it was exactly. When you asked who
messages.messageBody:
Hi,I had read an article about Masamune before in some Japanese
history magazine,Rekishi Dokuhon or so.But I forget where it was
exactly.

When you asked who was Koumitsushi,I confirmed in some Japanese
webpages Several pages said Masamune was the son of Yukimitsu
(Koumitsu) as I had known.
The theory is the most probable,I think,but some says Yukimitsu was
not Masamune's father and it is true the example of the name
Koumitsushi was rare.it was usual for Masamune not to carve his name
in the swords he made.

I think there must be many books in Japanese that include Masamune
story,but I don't know their particular names,sorry.

Regards

Shinsei


--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "wahmeister <wahmeister@y...>"
<wahmeister@y...> wrote:
> If "Sensei Shinsei" is here..........,
> How are things going?
> I have been wanting to write and ask another question about
> Masamune if posssible.
>
> I owe a great deal to you for helping me with the name
> Koumitsushi/Masamune.
> I have been searching the web and there is only one other place
I
> can find that says Goro Nyudo Koumitsushi was the great Masamune.
> Personally, I have no doubt that he was, but do you know if there
are
> any history books that are available that has this information in
it?
> In Japanese or English.
> Thank You, LB

messages.subject: Re: koumitsushi question
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I m just new to here and hope not bothering you by this reply. ... KOUMITSU-SHI means Son of Yukimitsu . (Masamune s father was Tohzaburou-Yukimitsu).
messages.messageBody:
Hi, I'm just new to here and hope not bothering you by this reply.

> I have been searching the web and there is only one other place I
> can find that says Goro Nyudo Koumitsushi was the great Masamune.

"KOUMITSU-SHI" means "Son of Yukimitsu".
(Masamune's father was Tohzaburou-Yukimitsu).
Yukimitsu is another pronunciation for charactors "KOUMITSU".

http://www.jttk.zaq.ne.jp/nihontou/rekishi/kamakura3.htm
Could this page be some help for you?
(Written in Japanese)

M.Nakazaki

messages.subject: koumitsushi question again for Shinsei
messages.msgSnippet: If Sensei Shinsei is here.........., How are things going? I have been wanting to write and ask another question about Masamune if posssible. I owe a great
messages.messageBody:
If "Sensei Shinsei" is here..........,
How are things going?
I have been wanting to write and ask another question about
Masamune if posssible.

I owe a great deal to you for helping me with the name
Koumitsushi/Masamune.
I have been searching the web and there is only one other place I
can find that says Goro Nyudo Koumitsushi was the great Masamune.
Personally, I have no doubt that he was, but do you know if there are
any history books that are available that has this information in it?
In Japanese or English.
Thank You, LB
